The 19th Patriarch, the Great Arhat KumÄra MahÄsattva, the son of a Brahmin in the Great Yuezhi Kingdom.

He asked,
My parents at home have always believed in the Three Jewels,
But they are constantly afflicted with illness.
Everything they try to do is not to their liking.
While my neighbor has long been a chandala,
His body is always strong and healthy, and everything he does goes well.
What good fortune does he have, and what misfortune do I have?
The Patriarch said,
What is there to doubt about this?
The retribution for good and evil comes in three times.
Ordinary people only see the virtuous being short-lived and the violent being long-lived, the wicked being lucky and the righteous being unlucky,
And they then say there is no cause and effect, and that sin and blessings are empty.
But they do not know that the correspondence between shadows and echoes
Is not even slightly off.
Even if one goes through a hundred thousand myriad kalpas, it is not obliterated.
The Buddha said that karma extends through the three periods of time.
This is because the good karma created in past lives is rewarded in this life.
If one does evil in this life,
It will be responded to in future lives.
Therefore, there are people in this life who do good but do not receive its blessings.
This is because the retribution for past evil deeds is greater.
In this life, one may do evil but not suffer its consequences.
This is because the goodness of past deeds is greater.
If one, having not received blessings in this life, continues to do evil,
one will fall further into evil realms in future lives.
If one, having received blessings in this life, continues to do good,
one will attain better realms in future lives.
Moreover, in past lives, one may have done good deeds,
but only halfway through,
one changes their mind and does evil.
In this life,
one's previous blessings are followed by misfortune.
In this life, one does evil,
but only halfway through,
one changes and does good.
In future lives,
one's previous misfortune is followed by blessings.
Now, your father and his neighbor,
the responses of their good and evil deeds did not come about by coincidence. They were brought about by past karma.
How can one seek it in just one lifetime?
At that time, Jayata, having heard these words,
suddenly released his doubts. The Patriarch said,
Although you have faith in the three karmas,
you have not yet understood that karma arises from delusion,
delusion is caused by consciousness,
consciousness relies on non-enlightenment,
non-enlightenment relies on the mind,
the mind is originally pure,
without birth or cessation, without creation,
without retribution or victory or defeat,
tranquil and still, yet spiritually aware.
If you enter this Dharma gate,
you will be the same as the Buddhas.
All good and evil, conditioned and unconditioned, are like dreams and illusions.
Jayata, following the words and grasping the meaning,
immediately aroused his innate wisdom and earnestly requested to leave home.
After receiving the precepts,

Then he gave him the Dharma eye verse:

He also said,
This is the phrase of the pure seeing of nature by the Tathagata Wonderful Sound.
You should spread it to later students.
After saying this, he immediately on the seat used his fingernails to open his face like a red lotus flower.

Question:
The teachings of Buddhism say that when a person dies, they will be reborn again.

He said: It becomes a ghost or spirit.

The soul and spirit are like the seeds and fruits of the five grains.
The roots and leaves are born and must die, but how can the seeds and fruits have an end?
